block.p: Danielle Nancy Dell'Olio, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Dell'Olio of New York, was married yesterday to Robert Thomas Elder Jr., the son of Mr. and Mrs. Elder Sr. of Apex, N.C. The Rev. Michael J. Walsh, an uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Victory Roman Catholic Church in New York.
The bride and bridegroom, both 26, graduated from Fairfield University, where they met.

Danielle Nancy Dell'Olio, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Dell'Olio of New York, was married yesterday to Robert Thomas Elder Jr., the son of Mr. and Mrs. Elder Sr. of Apex, N.C. The Rev. Michael J. Walsh, an uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Victory Roman Catholic Church in New York.
The bride and bridegroom, both 26, graduated from Fairfield University, where they met.

The bride is the manager of advertising and promotion at Pantheon Books in New York. Her father, a retired police officer who worked in the New York City Police Academy's video production unit, is an independent filmmaker and cinematographer in New York. Her mother, Felicia Dell'Olio, is a paralegal at Kirkpatrick & Lockhart, a New York law firm.

The bridegroom is a marketing manager in New York in the digital entertainment unit of Sony Pictures. His mother, Mary Ann Elder, retired as a nurse assistant at North Raleigh Pediatrics in Raleigh, N.C. His father retired from I.B.M., where he was a program director in its personal systems group in Research Triangle Park, N.C.; he is now the southeastern regional manager in Apex for Premier Technologies, a developer of telecommunications systems.
